alert.note: Alert for Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 04 at 11:20AM MST until December 04 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 318, 319, 320, AND 323... .A very dry air mass, with relative humidity values of 10 to 15 percent, and winds gusting to 30 mph across portions of the Black Hills and foothills are contributing to critical fire weather conditions this morning. Although some moderation in wind gusts and relative humidity may occur this afternoon, critical fire weather conditions will likely persist through at least the next few hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 318, 319, 320, AND 323... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 5 PM MST this afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 318 Wyoming Black Hills, 319 Northern Black Hills, 320 Central Black Hills and 323 Northern Foot Hills. * WINDS...West 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
